metadata.title: CVE-2014-4214 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the MySQL Server component in Oracle MySQL5.6.17 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affect availabilityvia vectors related to SRSP.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
